title: Otto I, Holy Roman Emperor
summary: Otto I (23 November 912 – 7 May 973), traditionally known as Otto the Great (German: Otto der Große, Italian: Ottone il Grande), was East Francian king from 936 and Holy Roman Emperor from 962 until his death in 973.[lower-alpha 2] He was the oldest son of Henry I the Fowler and Matilda.
